title: abysmal - across the board
text:
Anyone who reads my reviews knows I tend towards four or fives for hotels and restaurants. The Courtyard by Marriott at 866 Third Ave in Manhattan gets rounded up to a 2. I decided to stay here based on location and platinum Ritz Carlton status.
Sometimes you just need to admit you made a mistake.
The room was over $400 a night after tax and small even by NY standards. The TV didn't work and neither did the internet upon check in. I stay in hotels 150 plus nights a year so it isn't a matter of not knowing how different hotel systems work.
I called the guest services line and got a snarky response that all I needed to do was hit the channel "up" button twice and everything would be fine. Nine tries of turning the TV off and and on and trying that was enough. I walked down to the front desk and was told that "a lot of the remotes don't work". She called "engineering" - they brought me a new remote that worked fine. After 20 minutes the internet finally allowed me to log in but even with the "fast" $16.95 day internet option; I found it like stepping back into the 1990s speed wise.
I fully understand many people give this hotel good ratings but all I can write is my honest experience. As far a I am concerned Marriott owes me for false advertising. If this is really the Marriott brand, give me Hilton any day.
